activities:
There are only two ways BRG would receive any personal information:
•	a BRG employee or contractor were to image or forensically copy data from a person’s personal computer or other device, as distinct from a device provided by the person’s employer.  It seems that any time this would be required, BRG would be exempt from any Safe Harbor “choice” requirement or be required to provide the individual “access” to delete or correct any of the information.
•	BRG receives personal information in data provided by another party such as data collected from a company or in data produced from another party or entity.
Since any personal information, whether obtained from a person’s personal device or data obtained from their employer or any other party would be BRG work product, it would be kept confidential under BRG’s Data Security Policies and Procedures and there would be no use of the personal data that would require notice to the individual.
